00018 #ifndef _CVDENSE_H
00019 #define _CVDENSE_H
00020 
00021 #ifdef __cplusplus  /* wrapper to enable C++ usage */
00022 extern "C" {
00023 #endif
00024 
00025 #include <sundials/sundials_dense.h>
00026 #include <sundials/sundials_nvector.h>
00027 
00028 /*
00029  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00030  * CVDENSE solver constants
00031  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00032  * CVD_MSBJ : maximum number of steps between dense Jacobian
00033  *            evaluations
00034  *
00035  * CVD_DGMAX : maximum change in gamma between dense Jacobian
00036  *             evaluations
00037  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00038  */
00039 
00040 #define CVD_MSBJ  50
00041 #define CVD_DGMAX RCONST(0.2)
00042 
00043 /*
00044  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00045  * Type : CVDenseJacFn
00046  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00047  * A dense Jacobian approximation function Jac must have the
00048  * prototype given below. Its parameters are:
00049  *
00050  * N is the problem size.
00051  *
00052  * J is the dense matrix (of type DenseMat) that will be loaded
00053  * by a CVDenseJacFn with an approximation to the Jacobian matrix
00054  * J = (df_i/dy_j) at the point (t,y).
00055  * J is preset to zero, so only the nonzero elements need to be
00056  * loaded. Two efficient ways to load J are:
00057  *
00058  * (1) (with macros - no explicit data structure references)
00059  *     for (j=0; j < n; j++) {
00060  *       col_j = DENSE_COL(J,j);
00061  *       for (i=0; i < n; i++) {
00062  *         generate J_ij = the (i,j)th Jacobian element
00063  *         col_j[i] = J_ij;
00064  *       }
00065  *     }
00066  *
00067  * (2) (without macros - explicit data structure references)
00068  *     for (j=0; j < n; j++) {
00069  *       col_j = (J->data)[j];
00070  *       for (i=0; i < n; i++) {
00071  *         generate J_ij = the (i,j)th Jacobian element
00072  *         col_j[i] = J_ij;
00073  *       }
00074  *     }
00075  *
00076  * The DENSE_ELEM(A,i,j) macro is appropriate for use in small
00077  * problems in which efficiency of access is NOT a major concern.
00078  *
00079  * t is the current value of the independent variable.
00080  *
00081  * y is the current value of the dependent variable vector,
00082  *   namely the predicted value of y(t).
00083  *
00084  * fy is the vector f(t,y).
00085  *
00086  * jac_data is a pointer to user data - the same as the jac_data
00087  *          parameter passed to CVDense.
00088  *
00089  * NOTE: If the user's Jacobian routine needs other quantities,
00090  *       they are accessible as follows: hcur (the current stepsize)
00091  *       and ewt (the error weight vector) are accessible through
00092  *       CVodeGetCurrentStep and CVodeGetErrWeights, respectively
00093  *       (see cvode.h). The unit roundoff is available as
00094  *       UNIT_ROUNDOFF defined in sundials_types.h.
00095  *
00096  * tmp1, tmp2, and tmp3 are pointers to memory allocated for
00097  * vectors of length N which can be used by a CVDenseJacFn
00098  * as temporary storage or work space.
00099  *
00100  * A CVDenseJacFn should return 0 if successful, a positive value if 
00101  * a recoverable error occurred, and a negative value if an 
00102  * unrecoverable error occurred.
00103  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00104  */
00105 
00106 typedef int (*CVDenseJacFn)(long int N, DenseMat J, realtype t,
00107                             N_Vector y, N_Vector fy, void *jac_data,
00108                             N_Vector tmp1, N_Vector tmp2, N_Vector tmp3);
00109 
00110 /*
00111  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00112  * Function : CVDense
00113  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00114  * A call to the CVDense function links the main integrator with
00115  * the CVDENSE linear solver.
00116  *
00117  * cvode_mem is the pointer to the integrator memory returned by
00118  *           CVodeCreate.
00119  *
00120  * N is the size of the ODE system.
00121  *
00122  * The return value of CVDense is one of:
00123  *    CVDENSE_SUCCESS   if successful
00124  *    CVDENSE_MEM_NULL  if the cvode memory was NULL
00125  *    CVDENSE_MEM_FAIL  if there was a memory allocation failure
00126  *    CVDENSE_ILL_INPUT if a required vector operation is missing
00127  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00128  */
00129 
00130 int CVDense(void *cvode_mem, long int N);
00131 
00132 /*
00133  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00134  * Optional inputs to the CVDENSE linear solver
00135  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00136  *
00137  * CVDenseSetJacFn specifies the dense Jacobian approximation
00138  *                 routine to be used. A user-supplied djac routine
00139  *                 must be of type CVDenseJacFn. By default, a
00140  *                 difference quotient routine CVDenseDQJac, supplied
00141  *                 with this solver is used.                     
00142  *                 It also specifies a pointer to user data which is
00143  *                 passed to the djac routine every time it is called.
00144  *
00145  * The return value of CVDenseSet* is one of:
00146  *    CVDENSE_SUCCESS   if successful
00147  *    CVDENSE_MEM_NULL  if the cvode memory was NULL
00148  *    CVDENSE_LMEM_NULL if the cvdense memory was NULL
00149  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00150  */
00151 
00152 int CVDenseSetJacFn(void *cvode_mem, CVDenseJacFn djac, void *jac_data);
00153 
00154 /*
00155  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00156  * Optional outputs from the CVDENSE linear solver
00157  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00158  *
00159  * CVDenseGetWorkSpace returns the real and integer workspace used
00160  *                     by CVDENSE.
00161  * CVDenseGetNumJacEvals returns the number of calls made to the
00162  *                       Jacobian evaluation routine djac.
00163  * CVDenseGetNumRhsEvals returns the number of calls to the user
00164  *                       f routine due to finite difference Jacobian
00165  *                       evaluation.
00166  * CVDenseGetLastFlag returns the last error flag set by any of
00167  *                    the CVDENSE interface functions.
00168  *
00169  * The return value of CVDenseGet* is one of:
00170  *    CVDENSE_SUCCESS   if successful
00171  *    CVDENSE_MEM_NULL  if the cvode memory was NULL
00172  *    CVDENSE_LMEM_NULL if the cvdense memory was NULL
00173  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00174  */
00175 
00176 int CVDenseGetWorkSpace(void *cvode_mem, long int *lenrwLS, long int *leniwLS);
00177 int CVDenseGetNumJacEvals(void *cvode_mem, long int *njevals);
00178 int CVDenseGetNumRhsEvals(void *cvode_mem, long int *nfevalsLS);
00179 int CVDenseGetLastFlag(void *cvode_mem, int *flag);
00180 
00181 /*
00182  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00183  * The following function returns the name of the constant 
00184  * associated with a CVDENSE return flag
00185  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00186  */
00187 
00188 char *CVDenseGetReturnFlagName(int flag);
00189 
00190 
00191 /* CVDENSE return values */
00192 
00193 #define CVDENSE_SUCCESS           0
00194 #define CVDENSE_MEM_NULL         -1
00195 #define CVDENSE_LMEM_NULL        -2
00196 #define CVDENSE_ILL_INPUT        -3
00197 #define CVDENSE_MEM_FAIL         -4
00198 
00199 /* Additional last_flag values */
00200 
00201 #define CVDENSE_JACFUNC_UNRECVR  -5
00202 #define CVDENSE_JACFUNC_RECVR    -6
00203 
00204 #ifdef __cplusplus
00205 }
